IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE MASSACHUSETTS LEGAL ASSISTANCE CORPORATION PROVIDES LEADERSHIP AND SUPPORT TO IMPROVE CIVIL LEGAL SERVICES TO LOW-INCOME PEOPLE IN MASSACHUSETTS THROUGH COLLABORATION WITH THE LEGAL SERVICES COMMUNITY, THE LEGISLATURE, THE PUBLIC, THE BAR, AND THE JUDICIARY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MASSACHUSETTS LEGAL ASSISTANCE CORPORATION PROVIDES LEADERSHIP AND SUPPORT TO IMPROVE CIVIL LEGAL SERVICES TO LOW-INCOME PEOPLE IN MASSACHUSETTS THROUGH COLLABORATION WITH THE LEGAL SERVICES COMMUNITY, THE LEGISLATURE, THE PUBLIC, THE BAR, AND THE JUDICIARY.
IRS990.Desc: GENERAL SUPPORT TO LEGAL SERVICE PROGRAMS - MLAC AWARDS FUNDS AS GENERAL SUPPORT TO ELIGIBLE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS IN MASSACHUSETTS WHICH PROVIDE LEGAL ASSISTANCE TO LOW INCOME CLIENTS IN CIVIL LEGAL MATTERS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: MLAC WAS AWARDED, AS A COORDINATED STATEWIDE ADMINISTRATION OF CIVIL LEGAL SERVICES (CSAL), A GRANT FROM THE MASSACHUSETTS OFFICE FOR VICTIM ASSISTANCE (MOVA). THIS IS A CONTRACT THAT IS FUNDED THROUGH VICTIMS OF CRIME ACT (VOCA) FUNDING. THE PURPOSES OF THIS GRANT IS TO IMPLEMENT THE MASSACHUSETTS CIVIL LEGAL AID TO VICTIMS OF CRIME INITIATIVE (CLAVC) TO EXPAND THE CAPACITY OF LEGAL SERVICES PROGRAMS (THE PROGRAMS) IN THE STATE TO PROVIDE LEGAL ASSISTANCE TO VICTIMS OF CRIME WITH CIVIL LEGAL AID ISSUES RELATED TO THEIR VICTIMIZATION, INCLUDING IN PARTICULAR THOSE CRIME VICTIMS REFERRED BY MOVA. MLAC WILL SERVE AS RECIPIENT FOR CLAVC GRANT. IT WILL EXERCISE APPROPRIATE OVERSIGHT, IMPLEMENT FISCAL CONTROL, CARRY OUT REPORTING, AND MAKE SUB GRANTS TO THE PROGRAMS TO FULFILL THE OBLIGATIONS ACCORDING TO THE CONTRACT TERMS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THE MASSACHUSETTS LEGAL ASSISTANCE PROJECT (MLAP) IS A MULTI-YEAR GRANT FROM THE MASSACHUSETTS STATE LEGISLATURE TO FUND THREE SPECIAL PROJECTS: THE MEDICAL LEGAL PARTNERSHIPS PROJECT (MLP), THE HIGH-QUALITY EDUCATION FOR ALL PROJECT (EDU), AND THE FAMILY PRESERVATION PROJECT (FPP).THE MLP PROVIDES PEOPLE WITH LOW INCOMES ACCESS TO LEGAL ASSISTANCE IN A HEALTHCARE SETTING. IT ADDRESSES HEALTH-HARMING LEGAL NEEDS, PROMOTES HEALTH EQUITY, AND IMPROVES OVERALL HEALTH OUTCOMES BY ALLYING HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS AND ATTORNEYS. THE EDU WORKS TO DISMANTLE BARRIERS TO FAIR, EQUITABLE, AND HIGH-QUALITY EDUCATION FOR STUDENTS FROM FAMILIES WITH LOW INCOMES. THE FPP IS PROVIDING LEGAL ASSISTANCE AND RELATED SUPPORT SERVICES TO FAMILIES AT THE EARLY STAGES OF INVOLVEMENT WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF CHILDREN AND FAMILIES WITH THE GOAL OF KEEPING FAMILIES INTACT.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: PROGRAM SERVICE INITIATIVES - PROJECTS THAT ADVANCE COLLABORATION AMONG LEGAL AID PROGRAMS AND ENSURE THAT LIMITED RESOURCES ARE USED AS EFFECTIVELY AND EFFICIENTLY AS POSSIBLE.
MLAC PROVIDES ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES FOR THE IOLTA COMMITTEE, WHICH OVERSEES THE DISBURSEMENT OF IOLTA FUNDS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MLAC ADVOCATES WITH MEMBERS OF THE MASSACHUSETTS GENERAL COURT AND THE GOVERNOR'S OFFICE TO MAINTAIN AND INCREASE THE COMMONWEALTH'S APPROPRIATION TO MLAC. AS PART OF ITS ADVOCACY, MLAC ENGAGES THE SERVICES OF A LOBBYING FIRM, GOVERNMENTAL STRATEGIES, INC., RECRUITS VOLUNTEERS TO PERSONALLY CONTACT MEMBERS OF THE LEGISLATURE AND THE ADMINISTRATION ON OUR BEHALF, SENDS MAILINGS TO ALL MEMBERS OF THE MASSACHUSETTS GENERAL COURT AND TO THE GOVERNOR AND MEMBERS OF HIS ADMINISTRATION, PRODUCES FACT SHEETS AND OTHER PUBLICATIONS TO SUPPORT OUR ADVOCACY AND ORGANIZES AN ANNUAL WALK TO THE HILL FOR LEGAL SERVICES RALLY AT THE STATE HOUSE. MEMBERS OF THE PAID STAFF PARTICIPATE IN AND OVERSEE MLAC'S LEGISLATIVE EFFORTS. MLAC ALSO WRITES TO AND DIRECTLY CONTACTS MEMBERS OF THE MASSACHUSETTS CONGRESSIONAL DELEGATION TO URGE THEM TO SUPPORT ADEQUATE FUNDING FOR THE FEDERAL LEGAL SERVICES CORPORATION.

MLAC ACCOUNTS FOR UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES IN ACCORDANCE WITH ASC TOPIC, INCOME TAXES. THIS STANDARD CLARIFIES THE ACCOUNTING FOR UNCERTAINTY IN TAX POSITIONS AND PRESCRIBES A RECOGNITION THRESHOLD AND MEASUREMENT ATTRIBUTE FOR THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS REGARDING A TAX POSITION TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN A TAX RETURN. MLAC HAS DETERMINED THAT THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS WHICH QUALIFY FOR EITHER RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AT JUNE 30, 2023. MLAC'S INFORMATION RETURNS ARE SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY FEDERAL AND STATE JURISDICTIONS.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: CATHOLIC SOCIAL SERVICES OF FALL RIVER

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR LEGAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MASSACHUSETTS LEGAL ASSISTANCE CORPORATION (MLAC) MONITORS SEVERAL OF ITS GRANTEES IN VARIOUS GEOGRAPHIC REGIONS OF MASSACHUSETTS EACH YEAR. MLAC GOALS FOR THE MONITORING PROCESS ARE: 1)TO SHOW THAT THE PROGRAMS HAVE MET A PARTICULAR LEVEL OF QUALITY AND QUANTITY OF SERVICES. 2)TO IMPROVE THE SUBSTANTIVE WORK OF PROGRAMS. 3)TO IDENTIFY BEST PRACTICES. MLAC USES A PEER REVIEW MODEL TO ASSESS GRANTEES PERFORMANCE AND TAKES A FAIRLY COMPREHENSIVE APPROACH AS NOT ALL PROGRAMS ARE SITE VISITED EACH YEAR. DURING THE INTERIM, MLAC MAINTAINS FOCUS ON THEIR ISSUES BY MONITORING THEIR ANNUAL FUNDING APPLICATIONS, ANNUAL AND MID-YEAR REPORTS AND THEIR FINANCIAL AUDITS. THE PEER REVIEW MODEL CONSISTS OF MLAC CONTRACTING WITH ATTORNEYS AND CONTENT EXPERTS OUTSIDE OF MASSACHUSETTS TO SERVE AS INDEPENDENT CONSULTANTS. THESE ARE INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE WORK EXPERIENCE WITH LEGAL AID PROGRAMS AND BACKGROUNDS IN PROGRAM EVALUATION. THEY ASSESS PROGRAM OPERATIONS AGAINST A FRAMEWORK OF PERFORMANCE STANDARDS DEVELOPED BY MLAC (BASED ON THE AMERICAN BAR ASSOCIATION (ABA) STANDARDS) THAT FOCUS ON THE FOLLOWING AREAS: 1.STRATEGIC AND COLLABORATIVE PLANNING PARTNERSHIP 2.DEVELOPMENT AND UTILIZATION OF RESOURCES 3.CLIENT ACCESS 4.QUALITY ASSURANCE 5.EFFECTIVE MANAGEMENT AND ADMINISTRATION 6.GOVERNANCE PRIOR TO THE ON-SITE VISIT, THE PEER REVIEWERS RECEIVE A FAIRLY EXTENSIVE SET OF INFORMATION ON THE PROGRAM, INCLUDING ANNUAL REPORTS AND INFORMATION THAT IS INDICATIVE OF INTERNAL OPERATIONS SUCH AS STAFF TURNOVER, ATTORNEYS YEARS OF EXPERIENCE, BOARD AND STAFF DIVERSITY. THE PEER REVIEWER REVIEWS THIS INFORMATION, PREPARES AND ADMINISTERS INTERVIEW PROTOCOLS, CONDUCTS A SITE VISIT TO THE PROGRAMS OFFICE(S), AND COMPILES A REPORT IDENTIFYING THE PROGRAMS STRENGTHS, CHALLENGES AND RECOMMENDATIONS TO IMPROVE PERFORMANCE. THE PEER REVIEWERS ARE ALSO REQUIRED TO INTERVIEW BOARD MEMBERS, IN PARTICULAR THE PRESIDENT AND TREASURER, TO DETERMINE HOW WELL THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS PERFORMING ITS OVERSIGHT AND FIDUCIARY RESPONSIBILITY. MLAC FISCAL MANAGER CONDUCTS A REVIEW OF THE PROGRAM FINANCIAL OPERATIONS MONITORING A VARIETY OF AREAS SUCH AS WHETHER THE PROGRAM HAS SUBMITTED KEY DOCUMENTS, FOR EXAMPLE, IRS 990 AND THE MASSACHUSETTS PUBLIC CHARITIES FORM. THE FISCAL MANAGER ALSO REVIEWS VARIOUS ASPECTS OF THE PROGRAM FINANCIAL OPERATIONS INCLUDING THE PROGRAM AUDITED FINANCIALS, INSURANCE COVERAGE, PERSONNEL AND OTHER MANAGEMENT POLICIES, ACCOUNTING SOFTWARE AND EMPLOYEE BENEFITS. THERE IS CONSIDERABLE POTENTIAL FOR ORGANIZATIONAL CHANGE THROUGH THE PEER REVIEW PROCESS. THE SUCCESS OF MLAC PEER REVIEW MODEL RESTS ON THE FACT THAT THE PEER REVIEWERS ARE VERY ADEPT IN IDENTIFYING PROGRAMS' CHALLENGES AND MAKING RECOMMENDATIONS THAT IMPROVE THE SUBSTANTIVE WORK AND MANAGERIAL PRACTICES OF PROGRAMS. THE INDIVIDUAL PROGRAM DIRECTORS REPORT ON WHETHER THEIR PROGRAMS HAVE IMPROVED BECAUSE OF PEER REVIEW WHILE MLAC HAS ALSO OBSERVED ORGANIZATIONAL SHIFTS SUCH AS INCREASED FUNDRAISING AND STAFF DIVERSITY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FIRST THE 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, CFO AND THE FISCAL MANAGER. THEN THE ENTIRE FINANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE 990. THE 990 IS THEN SENT BY EMAIL ATTACHMENT OR PUBLISHED FOR THE BOARD ON THE WEBSITE WITH A NOTE THAT THE FINANCE COMMITTEE AND MANAGEMENT HAVE REVIEWED AND ACCEPTED THE 990. THE BOARD THEN HAS 5 DAYS TO RESPOND.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MLAC MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY THROUGH THEIR ANNUAL AUDIT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: WHEN DIRECTED BY THE BOARD, MLAC CONTRACTS WITH AN OUTSIDE FIRM TO PERFORM A SALARY STUDY. THE STUDY COMPARES SALARIES OF SAME SIZE ORGANIZATIONS AND POSITIONS. SALARY RANGE COMPARISONS AND RECOMMENDATIONS ARE PRESENTED TO THE BOARD BY THE CONSULTANT. THE BOARD VOTES ON CHANGES TO THE SALARY SCHEDULE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. ANNUAL AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE ALSO FILED WITH THE COMMONWEALTH OF MASSACHUSETTS.
MLAC DID NOT CHANGE THEIR OVERSIGHT PROCESS IN THE FISCAL YEAR 2023.
